title: A nice qol change for Anivia @Meddler, @Riot
body:
I've suggested this twice, both to Meddler and Repertoir, but I'm sure they were too busy to notice this. But I think it'd be a great qol change for Anivia if, whenever her passive Rebirth is active, she has a glimmer/sparkle to her entire body. I hate having to click on my ally Anivia, or enemy Anivia, to see if their egg is up because there's no other way of knowing otherwise. Unless there is, and I'm just ***totally*** missing it.

At least for the sake of clarity!

replies.body:
That's a great suggestion. 

Visual effects is generally our biggest bottle neck unfortunately, so I can't make any promises we'll get to this anytime soon. Will pass it on to the appropriate team though, see if there's any chance of getting something into the mid year mage update or at least the backlog for some point later on.

Anivia's tool tip also mentions this, but she is very strong early on, and it is encouraged that she plays aggressive (because she has rebirth). Many early kills I earn in games (KR, plat) come from the enemy forgetting about my passive, Rebirth. But sparkles that indicate this passive will not only help myself/yourself, it will ALSO HELP THE ENEMY, which is something I'm not sure all Anivia players want. Your opinion does not speak for the greater number of players out there. There is already the passive CD info shown when you click on the Anivia, ally or enemy. It is one of her hidden strengths. Letting the enemy underestimating is part of the strategy.

Conclusion: Your idea is good for beginners (which I assume you are) to identify things better; but it's not something all users want.

For example, Lissandra's passive makes her ice V-helmet shine, and when I see it glow, I know her next skill is mana free, so I put that into my calculations to trade with her.

Please. Meddler. That is not something all of us want. Anivia is already weakened with her R nerf....
balancing a champion by hiding a part of their kit is a really bad idea

Zac main here. That would actually be a pretty big nerf to him (voli too, actually). At least at low-mid elos (and I believe the casters even mentioned it in LCS, so it might be universal), people forget about his passive surprisingly often and you can bait people into bad fights. That being said, it would still be a good change since power shouldn't come from an enemy not thinking to click on you to check your buff bar.

I am gravely worried that you think this is a great suggestion.

When is Quinn and Graves getting the nerfs they deserve? It was openly admitted that nerfs were incoming for them for being too strong like MF.

Put your filthy fingers away from my Anivia and Vel' Koz. Also Vel's eye should have glowing effects when his ult is up, for clarity, right?

We don't feel that 'Clarity' means 'convey everything'. Ability CDs for example are generally hidden from the enemy and deliberately so. What we want to address however are cases where something is conveyed, but poorly. In Anivia's case the information on her passive state is available, it's just accessed via an awkward manner (click on her, find icon on buff bar) that's not an interesting test of skill or awareness. As a result we'd ideally want to either convey that clearly (visual effects you can see at a glance for example) or hide it entirely (make it a memory test/guessing game) depending on which we felt created better gameplay.

Would it not be the best of both worlds to just draw a picture of an egg on her icon above the minimap? That way allies are in the know, without much of a "click this, look there frantically", while still preserving the element of surprise for an enemy anivia (granted your not timing it when it was popped). 

I understand why you wouldn't want to telegraph it to an opposing team, but surely there's middle ground in the (allies) HUD's icon. Same for voli, zac, ect. There's an obvious advantage knowing when it is up. Which is precisely why you wouldn't make it a glowing border or some bs for everyone to see, but at the same time it's pretty vital for allies to know teamfighting in a panic.

I am curious, why is that your greatest bottleneck? Is coding visual effects more bug prone or time intensive, is that team smaller than others/always being pulled onto other projects, are visual effects considered "dangerous" (e.g. can cause too much clutter and make the game difficult to play), etc?

I'm not an artist or involved in art staffing, so there may be some things I'm unaware of. One of the big issues though is just that visual effects (VFX) is in demand for a really wide range of work. Smaller scope champion updates for example are often quite light on changes to base model, character animations etc, since they're generally focused on ability changes. Ability changes tend to be really demanding on VFX though. Similarly items or masteries, new or modified, don't need involvement from many disciplines, but often involve VFX work. Other types of work, like Hextech crafting or the Fire and Ice finishers from All Stars, also involve significant VFX input.
Thanks for the info, the bottleneck makes more sense in that light.
Lack of artists. They're _always_ after more.
It's also screen clutter more importantly

Counterplay to the so-called Cheese, is to KNOW AND REMEMBER Anivia has an egg. It's that simple. Everyone knows it. Who doesn't? You keep it in mind when you face an Anivia in lane. It's like knowing LeBlanc has insane damage at lvl 2, so you avoid her and keep a distance as soon as she hits 2. You can't let Rito point everything out to everyone; part of the experience with LoL is to memorize these things, and "learn the game"... Don't be that Zed that tries to duel with me at lvl 3, and upon dying and Anivia egging, call out "Lame!". Part of climbing the ladder (in other words, becoming better at the game) is to learn, know, and memorize each champion. You can't just put a label to everything in the game. What the hellllll???

Just to add some clarity. I may sound very condescending, but that's not because I want to.

To address your edit first: Yes, GA is universal. It also costs a decent amount of gold and costs an item slot that in most cases could be better spent on a more effective item. Flash is arguably the most effective summoner spell, especially for immobile champs, so 9 times out of 10 people are going to take it. It doesn't even compare to something like the egg.

Please keep in mind that this game needs to be fun for everyone, not just fun for you to play cheese champs and roflstomp on low elos. If you're going to whine and complain about giving Anivia a particle, then you need to take literally every other particle out of the game in order for it to be fair.

Egg baits are only a part of Anivia's style because she doesn't HAVE a particle. It's not what makes her unique, there are tons of other "bait" champs out there, as you yourself have mentioned. IMO the only people pulling "bait" plays like this are ones that CAN'T burst a carry from 100-0 with a single rotation which is on a relatively short cooldown. 

In the case of Voli baits, you basically just have to burst him hard enough. It's possible to kill him through the regen, and any grevious wounds item will counter it. You can counter voli's passive with an item's passive ability which, if his passive is proccing, has already applied it's debuff to him.

Zac's baits split him into four relatively weak pieces, totalling 48% of his health, and REDUCING his resistances.

Starting at level 12, Anivia GAINS resistances in egg form, and has 100 PERCENT of her natural health. Not only can she do crazy burst damage, but you have to kill her, at which point she gets a full health bar again and added armor and MR and you have to kill her AGAIN, and if you don't you can bet that 6 seconds later she's going to pop up and destroy you with a q-e combo.

Anivia's "egg baits" are overtuned.

it would give much needed clarity to her team, especially the jungler when he goes to gank middle lane because they can work around her passive as well.
I'd say yes, just give her a small buff for lower Elos in return.

While this would be helpful to a lot of players, it would be a nerf to anivia. Egg bait is a large part of her play that would be completely negated. She would need compensation buffs to remain viable.
